relation: Played during the opening credits. First opening would be OP01, second opening would be OP02, etc.
Played during the ending credits. First ending would be ED01, second ending would be ED02, etc.
Played once during one episode. For example, if played in the 3rd episode, the type would be IN03.
Played in the background on more than one occasion. Typically vocal-less.
textBeforeTable: "> Song types are used to identify how a song is used in an anime. For example, the song might play during the opening sequence, or in the background during one episode. Below are a list of song types, and their descriptions: BGMBackground MusicPlayed in the background on more than one occasion. Typically vocal-less. IN__Insert SongPlayed once during one episode. For example, if played in the 3rd episode, the type would be IN03. ED__Ending ThemePlayed during the ending credits. First ending would be ED01, second ending would be ED02, etc. OP__Opening ThemePlayed during the opening credits. First opening would be OP01, second opening would be OP02, etc. TypeMeaningDescription What are the song types? Yes! You may choose to hide a column by clicking on "Hide"
textAfterTable: What are Upload Points and how do they work? Upload points are assigned to a person when one of their uploaded files is deleted or added to the database. Positive points are given when the upload was useful, and negative points are given if the upload was in violation of one or more rules. Zero points are assignend if the upload was not used. You can view your upload points on your profile. Since uploads are often backlogged, you may receive your upload points as long as a month after uploading the file. Upload points can change your level! Please read the FAQ about Level for more
